result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

records.addlTxt: Atty Jason Lockery appointed
Initial Appearance set for March 28, 2022 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 2
**REFUSED TO SIGN**

Assistant District Attorney (ADA)  Brian Pfeil appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Max Bergner appears in court for defendant. 

1:28 PM Court calls case.
Atty Pfeil states appearances.

ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of obstructing an officer and possession of meth. 
Atty  Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner does not have any objections as to bond. 
Court addresses the fact this Defendant absconded from drug court, warrant was issued in 21CF-320 on January 31st. Court does not believe a signature bond is sufficient.
Court questions Atty Bergner.
Atty Bergner replies.

Initial Appearance scheduled for:  March 28, 2022  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2

Maintain absolute sobriety as to alcohol and drugs. Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Comply with requirements of drug court if he is still in drug court.
